job.title: Data Scientist
job.description: <p><strong>About Innowatts:</strong></p><p>A Utility-in-a-Box SaaS platform, combining energy data &amp; predictive analytics to enable energy providers to Increase customer value, Unlock grid edge opportunities and Accelerate energy transition.</p><p><br></p><p>Innowatts is backed by Energy Impact Partners, Shell Ventures, Iberdrola Energy Ventures, Veronorte and Energy and Environment Investment (Japan).</p><p><br></p><p><strong>Summary</strong></p><p>We are seeking a data scientist/programmer who thrives in a challenging environment, is passionate about technology products, and who can apply AI &amp; Machine learning data analytics techniques to build a scalable energy analytics platform. This position will work closely with the data science team to help support all facets of the data supply chain involving consumption and analytics. As a Jr. data scientist, this candidate can be involved in the following activities:</p><ul><li>Processing, cleansing, and verifying the integrity of data used for analysis</li><li>Perform predictive analysis i.e. load forecasting in different geographical regions and track forecast performance</li><li>Apply statistical analysis, machine learning modeling techniques, and data visualization methods</li><li>Involve in research for the new electrification trends</li><li>Doing ad-hoc analysis and presenting results in a clear manner</li></ul><p><strong>Responsibilities</strong></p><ul><li>Excellent understanding of machine learning techniques and algorithms, such as Neural Network, Random Forest, Gradient Boosting</li><li>Experience with common data science toolkits, such as Anaconda, Python, SQL</li><li>Experience with data visualization tools, such as Tableau, Power Bi, etc.</li><li>Expert in writing queries using SQL, AWS Athena etc.</li><li>Good programming skills in Python using different python packages&nbsp;</li></ul><p><strong>Minimum Qualifications</strong></p><ul><li>BS/MS degree in Engineering, with data science specialty discipline</li><li>At least 1-3 years of data analytics experience in a distributed computing environment</li><li>Good communication and presentation skills</li><li>Data-oriented personality</li></ul><p><strong>Benefits and Additional Perks</strong></p><ul><li>Fast paced, collaborative and fun environment</li><li>Work with data and latest technology to transform the industry</li><li>Competitive salary and bonus</li><li>401k</li><li>Medical, dental, vision, life, and long-term disability insurance</li><li>Paid vacation</li></ul><p><br></p>
